intro: Nigritella rhellicani var. cenisia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish.
